details.summary:
We work in Vietnam  through a 10-year Development Partnership Arrangement that will end in 2016.

DFID Vietnam also runs our remaining programmes in Cambodia
details.description:
Vietnam has developed rapidly over the last 2 decades, but significant development challenges remain.

More than 14 million people live below $1.25 a day. Half of ethnic minority households are poor.

The Millennium Development Goal target for HIV/AIDS is off track and the target for sanitation could be missed.

Macro-economic instability resulting for example in rising prices for basic commodities is negatively affecting poor people’s lives.

Climate change is a real threat: Vietnam is one of the top 5 countries likely to be most affected by sea level rise.

More effort is needed to make real progress in tackling corruption.

We committed to support the country to address these challenges through a 10-year Development Partnership Arrangement and will exit in 2016.

details.summary: UK Trade & Investment (UKTI) helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy.
details.description:
UKTI offers expertise and contacts through its extensive network of specialists in the UK, and in British embassies and other diplomatic offices around the world. We provide companies with the tools they require to be competitive on the world stage.

Responsibilities

UKTI in Vietnam helps companies in Britain increase their competitiveness through overseas trade in Vietnam. We also offer professional, authoritative and personalised assistance to help companies in Vietnam locate and expand in the UK.

Find out how we are increasing trade, investment and education links with Vietnam.
details.services:
Start a business in the UK

UKTI offers dedicated, professional, personalised assistance to help you locate and expand your business in the UK, read about our investment services or contact us to find out more.

Export from the UK

UKTI can assist you on every step of the exporting journey in both the UK and overseas, read about our exporting services or contact us to find out more.

Events

UKTI and its partners stage events in the UK and abroad to help companies looking to export. You can browse scheduled events and register for alerts.

Business opportunities

UKTI is always looking to provide an international network of opportunities for UK Companies looking to export. You can search these opportunities and register for alerts.

details.summary: The UK-Vietnam bilateral relationship has developed greatly since the establishment of full diplomatic relations in 1973. In 2010 the two countries entered into a Strategic Partnership demonstrating the breadth and depth of existing cooperation and shared level of ambition for the future.
details.description:
The Strategic Partnership provides a comprehensive framework for cooperation under these priority areas:

  • political – diplomatic cooperation

  • global and regional issues

  • trade and Investment

  • sustainable socio-economic development

  • education, training, science and technology

  • security and defence

  • people-to-people links

The UK presence in Vietnam includes the embassy in Hanoi and consulate general in Ho Chi Minh City. Department for International Development programmes are run out of an office in Hanoi and the British Council has an active presence in both Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City.
details.services:
Visas

For information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply go to the UK Border Agency website

Births, deaths and marriages

Information on how you can register a birth or death which occurred overseas, and legal documents for couples marrying or entering into civil partnerships abroad.

Passports and emergency travel documents

How to renew or replace your British passport when visiting the UK and information on getting replacement travel documents if your passport is lost or stolen.

Travel advice

Information on staying safe and avoiding problems when living or travelling abroad, with links to our embassies, high commissions and other diplomatic posts across the world.

Notarial and documentary services

Information about official documents, certificates, letters, and notes available at British Embassy in Hanoi and he British Consulate General in Ho Chi Minh City

Legalisation Service

How to get official confirmation that your UK public documentation is genuine so it can be accepted by foreign authorities. The UK does not require any documents to be legalised for use within the UK.

Friday: 8.30am to 12.30pm/ 1.00pm to 3.00pm
details.access_and_opening_times:
Making a consular appointment

Our embassies and consulates deal with a large number of urgent cases each year. Before contacting an embassy or consulate with non-urgent enquiries, please read our Support for British nationals abroad: a guide to see if the information you need is there. If you still cannot find the information you need, you can contact your nearest Consular team. You can make an appointment for notarial services at a British consulate from the list below:

  • Hanoi

  • Ho Chi Minh City

Disabled access

The Foreign & Commonwealth Office and this embassy are keen to ensure that their buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations we will endeavour to provide a service or access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at this embassy. We hope this information is helpful.

General physical access

There is clear, unobstructed access for vehicles to the front of the building, but there are six steps (without ramps) from the street into the office building. Building attendants can provide assistance.

  • Lifts: availability to all floors and accessibility for wheelchair-users.

  • Toilets: There are toilets at each level but these are not equipped for wheelchair access.

  • For security reasons, there is no parking available outside the building, but there is space for wheelchair transfer at drop off area.

  • Floor coverings are safe and even.

  • There are handrails in the elevators which are easy to grip.

  • The building doors are easily accessible to all users.

  • All areas of the building are well lit.

  • There is limited assistance for emergency evacuation of disabled visitors. In the event of an emergency, occupants must use the stairs to evacuate the building.

Access for visually-impaired visitors

  • Signs to the offices are clear, but not available in braille.
  • Guide dogs would be permitted into the building.

Access for deaf/hard of hearing visitors

  • Hearing loops are installed in the Embassy’s visa section but not in other parts of the building

  • Embassy staff and building attendants are not trained in sign language and professional signing interpretation is not available

  • Hearing dogs would be permitted into the building

Contact us

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that they may be inaccessible to you, please contact

The Head of Corporate Services Telephone: (+84) (4) 3936 0500

who will try to find an alternative way of providing access for you.

Public holidays

  • Tuesday 01 January: New Year’s Day

  • Monday 11 February - Friday 16 February: Tet

  • Friday 29 March: Good Friday

  • Monday 01 April: Easter Monday

  • Friday 19 April: Hung King Commemoration Day

  • Tuesday 30 April: Reunification Day

  • Wednesday 01 May: Labour Day

  • Monday 02 September: National Day

  • Wednesday 25 December: Christmas Day

  • Thursday 26 December: Boxing Day
